sentences.en: Dewdrops were still clinging on the trees.
He is of a clinging sort.
sentences.cn: 他是那种总要依靠别人的人.

sentences.en: Her glass had bits of orange clinging to the rim.
sentences.cn: 她的杯口上粘有些许橙汁。

sentences.en: His sodden trousers were clinging to his shins and his shoes squelched.
sentences.cn: 他湿透的裤子紧贴小腿，鞋子吧唧作响。

sentences.en: His sodden trousers were clinging to his shins.
sentences.cn: 湿淋淋的裤子紧紧粘在他小腿上。

sentences.en: I was nearly drowned through the drowning boy clinging to my neck.
sentences.cn: 由于那个溺水的孩子紧紧抱住我的脖子,我差点给淹死了.

sentences.en: I was terrified he would leave me, so I was clinging to him.
sentences.cn: 我害怕他会离开我，所以缠着他不放。

sentences.en: I was very frightened and clinging on like mad.
sentences.cn: 我很害怕,拼命地向上爬.

sentences.en: In clinging to these small issues you are the Maid's best advocates.
sentences.cn: 你们对这些小事纠缠不休,正好变成了少女最得力的辩护人.

sentences.en: More probably, while we try to compare the relative power of the West and the East, we are clinging to an obsolete vocabulary.
sentences.cn: 更有可能的是，当我们试图就西方和东方力量进行相对比较的时候，我们将会执着于已过时的词汇。

sentences.en: She was anxious not to appear clinging.
sentences.cn: 她竭力不让自己看上去显得过分依恋别人。

sentences.en: She wore clinging ivory silk jersey.
sentences.cn: 她穿着乳白色紧身绸衣。

sentences.en: She's clinging on to the past.

sentences.cn: 紧紧抓住救生筏的幸存者

sentences.en: They hugged each other, clinging together under the lights.
sentences.cn: 他们彼此拥抱，在灯光下紧紧相依。

sentences.en: You forget too his mama just, I clinging too his mama heart.
sentences.cn: 你忘记的太他妈干脆，我执着的太他妈心碎。

trans.tran_cn: 执着的，有黏性的，紧靠着的，紧贴着的
附着于( cling的现在分词 )，抓紧或抱住，坚持，依恋，依附于
